^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.
This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AveragingIntervalAchieved.description: Set to true if the averaging interval has been achieved.
AveragingIntervalAchieved.longDescription: Set to true if the averaging interval has been achieved. This property is only present if the reading is an average.

Reading.longDescription: The value of the reading. The unit is the same as the ReadingUnits.

ReadingTime.longDescription: The time of the reading. It is not applicable if the reading is an average.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

LastDay.description: Aggregated reading for the last day.
LastDay.longDescription: Aggregated reading for the last day.

LastHour.description: Aggregated reading for the last hour.
LastHour.longDescription: Aggregated reading for the last hour.

LastMonth.description: Aggregated reading for the last month.
LastMonth.longDescription: Aggregated reading for the last month.

LastWeek.description: Aggregated reading for the last week.
LastWeek.longDescription: Aggregated reading for the last week.

LastYear.description: Aggregated reading for the last year.
LastYear.longDescription: Aggregated reading for the last year.

DellOemSensor.description: This is the complex property for the additional OEM properties to complement DMTF Sensor Schema.
DellOemSensor.longDescription: This is the complex property for the additional OEM properties to complement DMTF Sensor Schema. This shall be used to represent an OEM Sensor for a Redfish implementation.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AverageReadings.description: An aggregation of averages of readings.
AverageReadings.longDescription: An aggregation of averages of readings.

CurrentState.description: The current state indicated by the Sensor. This value is always one of the PossibleStates.
CurrentState.longDescription: The current state indicated by the Sensor. This value is always one of the PossibleStates.

DeviceID.description: An address or other identifying information to uniquely name the LogicalDevice.
DeviceID.longDescription: An address or other identifying information to uniquely name the LogicalDevice.

DurationInCriticalThresholdPercent.description: The duration spent beyond the critical thresholds in percent.
DurationInCriticalThresholdPercent.longDescription: The duration spent beyond the critical thresholds in percent.

DurationInWarningThresholdPercent.description: The duration spent beyond the warning thresholds in percent.
DurationInWarningThresholdPercent.longDescription: The duration spent beyond the warning thresholds in percent.

LowestReadings.description: An aggregation of readings with the lowest value.
LowestReadings.longDescription: An aggregation of readings with the lowest value.

PeakReadings.description: An aggregation of readings with the highest value.
PeakReadings.longDescription: An aggregation of readings with the highest value.

PossibleStates.description: PossibleStates enumerates the string outputs of the Sensor. For example, a "Switch" Sensor may output the states "On", or "Off". Another implementation of the Switch may output the states "Open", and "Close". Another example is a NumericSensor that supports thresholds. This sensor can report states such as "Normal", "Upper Fatal", "Lower Non-Critical", and so on. A NumericSensor that does not publish readings and thresholds, but stores this data internally, can still report its states.
PossibleStates.longDescription: PossibleStates enumerates the string outputs of the Sensor. For example, a "Switch" Sensor may output the states "On", or "Off". Another implementation of the Switch may output the states "Open", and "Close". Another example is a NumericSensor that supports thresholds. This sensor can report states such as "Normal", "Upper Fatal", "Lower Non-Critical", and so on. A NumericSensor that does not publish readings and thresholds, but stores this data internally, can still report its states.

RequestedState.description: RequestedState is an integer enumeration that indicates the last requested or desired state for the element, irrespective of the mechanism through which it was requested.
RequestedState.longDescription: RequestedState is an integer enumeration that indicates the last requested or desired state for the element, irrespective of the mechanism through which it was requested.

TotalOperationalDuration.longDescription: The duration of total Operational days.

GetHistoricalSensorReadings.description: An action to retrieve historical readings of the sensor.
GetHistoricalSensorReadings.longDescription: An action to retrieve historical readings of the sensor. The action shall accept a parameter ReadingHistoryPeriod to specify the period for which the readings shall be returned.

ReadingHistoryPeriod.description: The parameter for specifying the reading history period.
ReadingHistoryPeriod.longDescription: The parameter for specifying the reading history period. Valid values are LastHour, LastDay and LastWeek.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

GetHistoricalSensorReadingsResponse.description: The response payload for the GetHistoricalSensorReadings action.
GetHistoricalSensorReadingsResponse.longDescription: The response payload for the GetHistoricalSensorReadings action.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

enumDescriptions.LastDay: Historical readings for the last day.
enumDescriptions.LastHour: Historical readings for the last hour.
enumDescriptions.LastWeek: Historical readings for the last week.
